entry.title: Champagne Problems
entry.summary:
Author: ash_ptv

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,275Chapters: 9/9Kudos: 42

Summary: Following the events of Eddie leaving for Texas and Buck's one night stand with Tommy, Buck has to face the reality of not only living in LA without Eddie but living in what was Eddie's old house. Maddie has already encouraged Buck to learn to be alone and stay away from relationships knowing how her little brother can get when he is upset and not thinking clearly. Buck seems to be taking Eddie's advice to "not make everything about him" to heart and is avoiding sharing details of his personal life and struggle with his crew. Will this be a chance for Buck to get back together with his most recent ex? Or will Buck look more into the idea that his feelings for Eddie aren't as platonic as he may think as Tommy and Maddie have suggested.Eddie is finally back with Chris and he has a lot of time while job searching to focus on how he feels now that Buck isn't 20 minutes away anymore. Is Chris really satisfied in his life with Texas now that it is not just a place he could run from his dad? Why does Chris feel like part of his family is still in California, and not the family he was running from? How will Eddie feel now that Buck seems to be talking with Tommy again?

entry.title: This Place Could Be Beautiful, Right? You Could Make This Place Beautiful.
entry.summary:
Author: Mariereads167

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,958Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 1

Summary: Life is no longer the same for Eddie and Buck. The last seven years of comfort and familiarity are threatened to be washed away and in its place now is a physical seperation by hundred of miles.But alas, they trudge on.Buck learns how to love himself amidst loneliness and how to let that be enough.Eddie grapples with his shifting identity and what it means to be unsure of yourself in a world that seems to be so unforgiving.Both men find love in one another and in their diverging lives. And even in the weeks and months to come, as they make their way back to one another, they realize that loving themselves is the only foundation their relationship can rest on.OR: Buck remains in LA with his lingering feelings in this new chapter of his life without Eddie by his side.Eddie is in Texas working on his relationship with Christopher.When you are a parent, you are trying to sell the world to your children.‘Any decent realtor, walking you through a shithole, chirps on about good bones.'And both Buck and Eddie realize that to love the world, they must first love who they are in it.

entry.title: Shape Of You.
entry.summary:
Author: Pnk_strawberry1

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,338Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 20

Summary: Eddie Diaz is a renowned professional fighter, celebrated for his power in the ring, and a devoted single father to his son Christopher, who brings immense joy to his life. However, Eddie has a deep-seated dislike for the idea of soulmates and predetermined relationships.On the other hand, Evan Buckley, a brave firefighter, has always held onto the hope of finding his soulmate, and his dreams have been filled with visions of their perfect encounter. So, when he finally meets Eddie on a normal Tuesday call, he is happy, excited, overjoyed, only to discover that his soulmate hates the idea of soulmates and is straight!?Will they be able to overcome their differences and find a deeper connection?———OREddie Diaz, a professional fighter and single father, Evan Buckley a firefighter, Happened to be soulmates! They are meant for each other, right? One problem though will maybe two Eddie Diaz hates Soulmates and is also Straight!?

entry.title: A Life From Another Sunset
entry.summary:
Author: glosspetras

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,889Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 3

Summary: In a fateful night, the discovery of betrayal shakes Buck's world, culminating in a desperate escape with his daughter Hanna amidst a relentless storm. Fate, however, deals a cruel blow: a car accident throws them into an abyss of uncertainty. Buck falls into a coma for three long years, a time when the world around him moves on. Hope for his awakening fades, leading Eddie to find solace and a new future alongside Laís, to whom he becomes engaged.Christopher, now a 12-year-old pre-teen, and Hanna, the sweet 4-year-old daughter who barely remembers her father, grow up in a new home. Eddie's family, eager for a definitive fresh start, pressures him to have Buck's life support turned off. On the eve of this final decision, on the same night that Eddie celebrates his engagement to Laís, a miracle happens: Buck wakes up. Three years of silence are broken, and he returns to a world that has left him behind, a world where his great love is about to marry another, and his family barely recognizes him. Now, Buck will need to fight not only to recover physically, but also to win back the hearts of those he has lost, unraveling the threads of a new reality where the past and present collide in an overwhelming way.

entry.title: Old Married Couple
entry.summary:
Author: luvthewolverine

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,200Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 47

Summary: Eddie and Buck unknowingly act like a married couple, with their seamless teamwork and care for each other. Their teammates tease them about it, and Eddie begins to realize how true it is. By the end, he understands that their bond is already like a family, even without needing labels.
